subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] get your news in QS!
msgSnippet: ... Well, it s good to see you have some amount of fluency. It sounds like you get stuck on some unfamiliar words. Right now it takes me 1/2 hour (or more,
messageBody:
pgabhart wrote:
>
>
> A fluent reader recognizes words at sight and doesn't have to break them
> down into individual syllables or letters. However, in reading your
> news today, I saw numerous words in QS for the first time. The shorter,
> common words I read quickly and essentially automatically just as I do
> in TO. But three, four and five syllable words that are unfamiliar are
> a different matter. Here are a few words I remember reading in QS for
> the first time today, and there are countless others: Islamabad, Islamic
> militants, Afghanistan, Land Cruiser, bullet-proofed (this last one
> hasn't come up much in my personal note-taking.) :-).
>

Well, it's good to see you have some amount of fluency. It sounds like
you get stuck on some unfamiliar words. Right now it takes me 1/2 hour
(or more, perhaps) just to read one article. Yes, I know it is a matter
of word recognition.

It would be very interesting to see what happened if you taught your
child QS. Would he absolutely rebel against TO, wondering why in the
world it is spelled as it is?

Paul
